problems.title: Insert a Node in AVL Tree (Simple Version)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an empty AVL Tree.
Insert a single integer value into the AVL Tree and print the height of the tree after insertion.

AVL Tree is a self-balancing Binary Search Tree where:
- Balance Factor (BF) = height(left) − height(right)
- BF must be −1, 0, or +1 for every node
- If insertion makes the tree unbalanced, rotations are used (LL, RR, LR, RL)

However, in this simple version, you insert ONLY ONE value into an EMPTY AVL Tree.
So no rotation is required, and the height will always be 1.

Input Format
A single integer X: the value to insert.

Output Format
Print:
height: H
(where H is the final height of the AVL Tree)

Example
Input:
10

Output:
height: 1

Explanation:
Tree was empty → insert 10 → height becomes 1.

Example 2
Input:
25

Output:
height: 1
problems.examples:
Sample Input 1
10

Sample Output 1
height: 1

Sample Input 2
5

Sample Output 2
height: 1

hintsList: Since the tree starts empty and only one value is inserted, height will always be 1.
AVL rotations are not needed here; focus on understanding insertion and height definition.
